About Me

Let me tell you a few things!

BIO

A Beta Gamma Sigma scholar graduating with a masters in IT and Management in May 2023 from The University of Texas at Dallas as a "summa cum laude" student. Currently working as a graduate teaching assistant for graduate and undergraduate project management courses. 6+ years of experience as a project coordinator , software developer , product manager in The UK and India. Having been a Certified Scrum Product Owner with an ideal blend of experience in both technical and management, I have worked with cross-functional and cross-cultural teams. I am proficient in Product and Project management and aspire to advance my career in the same.

M.S. in Information Technology and Management

The University of Texas at Dallas, Dallas,TX

Graduate Teaching Assistant, Jan 2023 - May 2023

As a Graduate Teaching Assistant,I am actively involved as a Grader, a Proctor, and a student leader. I am responsible for creating assignments and exams and mentoring around 200 students on project management practices and principles for both undergraduate and Graduate students.

Jaguar Land Rover - Tata Elxsi, Gaydon,The United Kindom/Bengaluru,India

Specialist,Software Coordinator/Software Developer, Jun 2016 - Dec 2021

• Collaboration with cross-functional teams that include controls, software, and systems to gather requirements.
• Implemented agile methodology through scrum framework to manage software development efforts.
• Managed 200+ User Stories tickets on JIRA and tracked the progress of each JIRA ticket.
• Performed UAT to make sure specifications of User Stories are completed, before closing JIRA tickets.
• Primarily involved in troubleshooting SW build issues, and root cause analysis (RCA).
• Regular meetings with stakeholders and practice groups to iterate continuous process improvement.
• Product backlog prioritization in accordance with business priorities, task allocation, and tracking in JIRA.
• Developed a process for integrating powertrain components as a single application to generate embedded C code.
• Trained and managed a product team of 20 to work on embedded product development over a period of 6 months and help coordinate the release of software on time with 100% team performance.
